text:
Hi everyone :wave:,
I've run into an issue regarding user identification on HubSpot-hosted sites. On <http://hs-sites.com|hs-sites.com>, I can differentiate between HubSpot admin users and regular membership users, using the `membership_email` variable when I'm logged in as an admin. However, on my custom domain, even as an admin, I'm redirected to the login form.
Has anyone else faced this issue? How can I distinguish between regular users and admin users logged into HubSpot when hosted on my own domain?
Thanks in advance!
cc <@U01QVR44MEY>
we also noticed this today, does it still appear for you, or do the new dev accounts have enterprise trial? Was it a bug?
You can check if the user is logged in using the request_contact.is_logged_in hubl variable. <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/hubl/variables>
no i know this , i would like to know if the user is logged in the HubSpot platform not in the membership.
I'm not entirely sure you can do this, but you could check if the user is checking the page in any of the editors or previewers

Hi Carter!
Thank you for the suggestion about checking if the user is in one of the HubSpot editors or preview modes.
Could you provide further insights on how I can actually recognize the user within the HubSpot editor? Specifically, is there a variable or a method I can use to print their email or identify them in some way while they are in the editor?
Any guidance or resources you can provide would be highly appreciated.
Thanks again!
Thank you very much, however, how do I trace the email of the HubSpot user who is making the changes at that time?
I signed up for a completely fresh account just to check, and seeing the "Upgrade" flow
